result.execSummary:
The defendant MARQUS G PHILLIPS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. MARQUS G PHILLIPS is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • MARQUS G PHILLIPS was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • MARQUS G PHILLIPS was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count 2 and to any previously imposed sentence.  Credit for time served (as listed below) shall be applied to conditional time.   Good time granted. Huber granted if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report, IN PERSON, to the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, after sentencing with a completed GPS application and to arrange a report date.  Failure to report to jail/huber shall result in loss of work release privileges and a warrant shall be authorized.

Fine and costs to be paid within 60 days of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
KNOWINGLY VIOLATE A DOMESTIC ABUSE ORDER (REPEATER, DV), DC (REPEATER, DV), CDTP (REPEATER, DV)
CONDITIONS:  No contact with V1 in Oshkosh PD report # 22-21676.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns.

02:44 PM Defendant MARQUS G PHILLIPS in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer & Intern Leon.  Defendant MARQUS G PHILLIPS in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  MARQUS G PHILLIPS appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Victim addresses the court.  Record closed @ 2:51.
